intro: Pterodiscus somanei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. Pterodiscus somanei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
